ul.li1: Wail, ships of Tarshish, for the house is destroyed so that no one can enter;Literally “it is destroyed from a house from entering”
ul.li2: it is announced to them from the land of Cyprus.
ul.li1: 2Be still, inhabitants of the coast,
ul.li2: merchant of Sidon, who travels over the sea, they filled you.
ul.li1: 3And on the great waters is the seed of Shihor,
ul.li2: the harvest of the Nile is its produce,
and she was the merchandise of the nations.
ul.li1: 4Be ashamed, Sidon, for the sea,
ul.li2: the fortress of the sea said, saying,
ul.li1: “I was not in labor,
ul.li2: and I have not given birth,
ul.li1: and I have not reared young men,
ul.li2: broughtOr “I have brought” up young women.”
ul.li1: 5When the report comes to Egypt,
ul.li2: they will be in anguish at the report aboutLiterally “of” Tyre.
ul.li1: 6Cross over to Tarshish!
ul.li2: Wail, inhabitants of the coast!
ul.li1: 7Is this your exultant one,Literally “this to you, exultant” her origin from the days of long ago?
ul.li2: Her feet brought her to dwell afar as an alien.
ul.li1: 8Who has planned this against Tyre, the bestower of crowns,Hebrew “crown”
ul.li2: whose merchants were princes,
her traders the honored ones of the earth?
ul.li1: 9Yahweh of hosts has planned it:
ul.li2: to defile the pride of all glory,
to humble all the honored ones of the earth.
ul.li1: 10Cross over your own land like the Nile, daughter of Tarshish;
ul.li2: there is no longer a harbor.Hebrew “waistband” is emended to “harbor” by transposing two consonants
ul.li1: 11He has stretched his hand out over the sea;
ul.li2: he has made kingdoms shake.
ul.li1: Yahweh has commanded concerning Canaan
ul.li2: to destroy her fortresses.

ul.li1: “You will not continueLiterally “do again longer” to exult, crushed one, virginLiterally “virgin of the” daughter of Sidon.
ul.li2: Arise, cross over to Cyprus! There will be no rest for you even there.”
ul.li1: 13Look at the land of the Chaldeans!
ul.li2: This people no longer exists.
Assyria destinedLiterally “this people was not Assyria destined,” which could be translated “It was this people! It was not Assyria. They destined” it for wild animals.
ul.li1: They erected its siege towers;
ul.li2: they demolished its citadel fortresses.
It made her like a ruin.
ul.li1: 14Wail, ships of Tarshish!
ul.li2: For your fortress is destroyed.

chapter.p: 15And this will happen on that day: And Tyre will be forgotten seventy years,Hebrew “year”
like the days of one king. At the end of seventy years,Hebrew “year” it will be for Tyre like the song of the prostitute:

ul.li1: 16“Take a harp,
ul.li2: go around the city, forgotten prostitute!
ul.li1: Do it well, playing a stringed instrument!
ul.li2: Make numerous songs,Hebrew “song” that you may be remembered.”

chapter.p: at the end of seventy years,Hebrew “year” Yahweh will visit Tyre,

ul.li1: and she will return to her harlot’s wages,
ul.li2: and she will commit fornication
ul.li1: with all the kingdoms of the world on the face of the earth.

chapter.p: her merchandise and her harlot’s wages will be set apart for Yahweh;

ul.li1: it will not be stored up,
ul.li2: and it will not be hoarded,
ul.li1: but her merchandise will be for those who live before the presenceLiterally “face” of Yahweh,
ul.li2: for eating to satiation and for fine clothing.
